entry.title: Tentacles of Love
entry.summary:
Author: LadyArkin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,735Chapters: 5/10Kudos: 45

Summary: He wasn’t even offering much more than, “I need a favor, buddy.”Batman’s marriage proposal was sudden and…strategic.Once they’ve spent some time together, Batman talks Superman into marrying for a mission. A mission that Bruce declares to be entirely selfish which he needs for business purposes. This mission isn’t supposed to be impactful to either of their personal lives.It starts when Bruce releases pictures of Batman proposing to Superman. He didn’t need more than a distraction and if it hadn’t been for an intervention from their family and friends, it wouldn’t have been. The more involved their blended family gets into their relationship, the more that they are supported in their relationship.

entry.title: Batman's not-so super spectacular week
entry.summary:
Author: N1XX

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,967Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 5

entry.title: I hate my own reflection (I see myself in you)
entry.summary:
Author: somagni

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 51,113Chapters: 11/12Kudos: 71

Summary: When Thwayne plucks Thomas Wayne from his crumbling universe as an act of revenge, three unexpected things happened. One: Kal had refused to let him go, he'd clung to his friend through time and space. Two: He was not in the universe of the Bruce he knew, this Bruce was young, barely a Bat, this Bruce was savable. Three: Alfred, full stop, because everything about Alfred in every universe is unexpected.Prompt: DC Multiverse week Day one - Second chance.

entry.title: Whispers through the grapevine
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,810Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 7

Summary: There were whispers in the court, among the maids, and among the soldiers alike that the second Prince had a secret lover. Their kind, brave, and lovable prince had been seduced by a harlot who would visit the Prince's chamber every night and leave by sunrise, unheard and unseen.But Bruce knew, and he knew more than he needed to be. There had not been a single whisper that could escape his ear and the truth always followed not so far behind.Clark had entangled himself in a trivial love affair with his loyal soldier, the Emerald Knight, Hal Jordan. Someone important enough for Bruce, the true First Prince of El, to remember yet insignificant enough for him not to bat an eye. A nobody who would play a role as his half-brother's first heartbreak, a mere pebble on Kal-El's road to maturity, and the first brush strokes that would be layered with many more in Kal-El's canvas of life.That was what Bruce had thought.But it seemed like the Emerald Knight had a knack for proving him wrong.
